headline: Ford's BlueOval City in Tennessee faces another delay as mass production bumped back
summary: Ford Motor Co. plans to delay mass production of its new electric trucks at BlueOval City in Stanton until 2028.

raw.headline: Ford's BlueOval City in Tennessee faces another delay as mass production bumped back
raw.summary: Ford Motor Co. plans to delay mass production of its new electric trucks at BlueOval City in Stanton until 2028.

headline: Ford delays electric pickup, van to 2028 as it chases smaller, affordable options
summary: (Reuters) -Ford Motor is delaying the launch of two next-generation electric vehicles as it shifts its focus to smaller and more affordable models, the company said on Thursday.  The automaker said it recently informed suppliers that a full-size electric pickup, scheduled for production at its BlueOval City assembly plant in Tennessee, will be delayed from 2027 to 2028.  "F-150 Lightning, America’s best-selling electric truck, and E-Transit continue to meet today’s customer needs," the company said, adding that it "will be nimble in adjusting our product launch timing to meet market needs and customer demand while targeting improved profitability."

raw.headline: Ford delays electric pickup, van to 2028 as it chases smaller, affordable options

"F-150 Lightning, America’s best-selling electric truck, and E-Transit continue to meet today’s customer needs," the company said, adding that it "will be nimble in adjusting our product launch timing to meet market needs and customer demand while targeting improved profitability."

headline: Chris Auffenberg Announces Limited-Time Ford Sales Event with Zero Percent APR and More
summary: Chris Auffenberg is offering a compelling new retail offer for qualified customers interested in select Ford vehicles. This limited-time promotion delivers a combination of zero percent APR financing, no-money-down options, deferred payments, and a complimentary maintenance plan—designed to make driving a new Ford more accessible and affordable than ever.

raw.headline: Chris Auffenberg Announces Limited-Time Ford Sales Event with Zero Percent APR and More

headline: Ford delays electric pickup, van to 2028 in shift to more affordable EVs
summary: The delays come as Ford pivots its focus to a low-cost EV platform designed to underpin a handful of smaller models, starting with a small pickup in 2027.

headline: Peloton to cut more jobs, forecasts strong 2026 revenue; shares soar
summary: The layoffs, along with plans to slash indirect costs and relocate some offices, are expected to help save an additional $100 million by the end of its next fiscal year, it said on Thursday.  CEO Peter Stern, who joined the company in January from Ford Motor, had kicked off the turnaround effort to address a slump in sales of Peloton's high-end stationary bikes and treadmills following a boom during the COVID lockdowns, when people were looking to work out at home.  Gross profit in the segment rose 96% to $34.4 million.

raw.headline: Peloton to cut more jobs, forecasts strong 2026 revenue; shares soar

headline: 1 Auto Stock That Actually Stands to Benefit From Tariffs
summary: Here's how one automaker stands to benefit from the current tariff environment.

raw.headline: 1 Auto Stock That Actually Stands to Benefit From Tariffs

headline: Toyota warns of $9.5 billion tariff hit, slashes annual profit forecast
summary: TOKYO (Reuters) -Japan's Toyota Motor said on Thursday it expected a hit of nearly $10 billion from President Donald Trump's tariffs on cars imported into the United States, the highest such estimate yet by any company, underscoring growing margin pressures.  "It's honestly very difficult for us to predict what will happen regarding the market environment," Takanori Azuma, Toyota's head of finance, told a briefing, vowing to keep making cars for U.S. customers, regardless of tariff impact.
